title: Twelve firefighters and a cherry picker try to free bird hooked on a lamppost with fishing wire
text:
This is the moment a dozen firefighters with an aerial reach platform launched a rescue operation to save a seagull tied to a lamp post by fishing wire.

Video footage shows the bird dangling in the air from the street light, flapping around helplessly as the rescuers tried to help in Greenock, Inverclyde, in Scotland on Monday.

It was spotted by grandfather-of-three Michael Gallagher, 57, while he was out having his lunch.

He noticed the large fire service presence near the sea, and was worried someone had fallen in the water, so he went to see what was going on.

Welder Michael said: 'I thought something serious had happened because there was a lot of firemen over there.

'I was wondering if someone was in trouble in the water.

'But then I saw the bird up there flapping. It had fishing wire tangled around its foot.

'It was dangling from the street light and I did feel sorry for it. It was completely stuck up there.

'It's not nice to see an animal in distress.'

Scottish Fire and Rescue Service had to deploy an aerial reach platform to reach the dangling bird.

The bird was cut free and released. Scotland Fire and Rescue Service said crews left the scene after passing the animal into the care of the Scottish SPCA

Michael said he was surprised so many firefighters had been called out to rescue the gull.

He said: 'There were at least ten fire officers there and I was surprised.

'I thought something really serious had happened and that's why I went over to have a look.'

Scotland Fire and Rescue Service said crews left the scene after passing the animal into the care of the Scottish SPCA.

A Scottish Fire and Rescue Service spokesman said: 'We were alerted at 3.57pm on Monday, October 21 to reports of a seagull trapped in wiring attached to a lamppost in Greenock.

'Operations Control mobilised one fire appliance and one aerial appliance to the town's Rue End Street, where firefighters help remove the bird to safety.'
description: Footage shows the bird dangling in the air from the street light, flapping around helplessly as the rescuers tried to help in Greenock, Inverclyde, Scotland on Monday. It was later cut free.
